answers.answer: Hi there.  Are you feeling tingling and numbness In both your feet? Is there any difficulty in walking and feeling blunt objects? in peripheral neuropathy, there is tingling and numbness and decreased sensations and possibility of increased trauma to foot. the causes might be alcoholism, vitamin B12 deficiency, hypothyroidism, diabetes mellitus, etc. your neurologist will examine your sensory and motor abilities in detail along with reflexes and deep tendon jerks.  Certain blood tests would help pin down the diagnosis. Management would be according to the cause. Take care.

question: Dr. informed me to have Neurologist examine both of my legs apparently neuropathy has sett in
title: Neurapathy
